intro: Sida grazielae, commonly known as the Grace's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the island of Guam in the Pacific Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, heart-shaped leaves, and showy yellow flowers with purple markings. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Sida grazielae is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution.
